newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sumitomo Trust falls on CB issuance report.
newsitem.headline: Sumitomo Trust falls on CB issuance report.

text.p: Sumitomo Trust & Banking Co Ltd fell in early Monday morning trade on a newspaper report which said the trust bank was planning to issue convertible bonds overseas as early as June, brokers said.
As of 0041 GMT, the share was down 50 yen, or 4.59 percent, at 1,040. It was the second largest percentage loser on the first section of the Tokyo bourse.

The Nihon Keizai Shimbun said on Monday that Sumitomo and Toyo Trust & Banking Co Ltd would issue convertibles overseas to reinforce their capital bases to meet a new capital adequacy standard to be imposed by the Bank for International Settlements at the end of March 1998.
Sumitomo was planning to issue 100 billion yen worth of convertibles while Toyo was planning 50 billion yen worth, the financial daily said.
A Sumitomo spokesman said although the bank was considering equity financing, the timing had not been decided.
Toyo Trust shares were down 17 yen at 814.
A Toyo spokesman said that the public relations department was not aware of the equity financing plans.
